newsitem.title: UK: Rolls-Royce says United deal worth 55 mln stg.
newsitem.headline: Rolls-Royce says United deal worth 55 mln stg.

text.p: Rolls-Royce Plc said on Friday that its share of the confirmed business from United Airlines' order for 24 new narrow-body A319 aircraft from Airbus Industrie totalled 55 million stg.
"The value of the confirmed business to International Aero Engines (IAE) is $260 million, with Rolls-Royce's share totalling $85 million (55 million stg)," it said in a statement.
IAE is a partnership of Pratt & Whitney, Rolls-Royce, MTU (Daimler Benz) and the Japanese Aero Engines Corporation, it added.
Rolls-Royce said the United Airlines order also included "an unspecified number of options" in addition to the 24 firm orders for the V2500-powered A319 twinjet.
"This decision firmly establishes the V2500 on the A319 and shows United's confidence in both the Airbus and V2500 product families," Barry Eccleston, IAE's chairman and CEO said.
